explains: n. 发烧，发热；狂热，高度兴奋；热病
v. 使发烧，使激动不已
wordGroup: dengue fever 登革热（一种传染病）
hay fever [医]枯草热；[医]花粉病
rheumatic fever [病]风湿热；急性关节风湿病
swine fever 猪瘟疫（等于hog cholera）
epidemic hemorrhagic fever 流行性出血热
fever of unknown origin 无明显病因的发烧
fever pitch n. 狂热；极度兴奋
spring fever 春倦症；枯草热

sentences.en: He had an earache and a fever.
My Uncle Jim had a high fever.
sentences.cn: 我的叔叔吉姆发高烧了。

sentences.en: The fever has passed its crisis.
